intro: Orthocarpus faucibarbatus subsp. typicus, commonly known as the typical faucet beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
